title: Why is Tibet part of China despite being culturally closer to India? - Quora

response.answer_text: Han Chinese and Tibetan Chinese: Belong to the same race. Check. Chinese and Tibetan launguge belong to the same Sino-Tibet launguge group. Check. Both had the same ancestors about 6000 years ago. Some went to plateau, became Tibetan Chinese. Some went to live in plain,became Han Chinese. That is why we speak the launguge belonging to the same launguge group. Check. Both believe in Mahayana Buddhism. Check. Both live in the same continent. Check. Both are closer geographicly. Check. Both once belonged to the same Chinese empire, the same country. Check. Traditional building similar. Check. Traditional national clothes similar too. Check. Drank tea long long before other places. Check. Both interacted with each other since long before. Check. Good or bad. Shared long common history memory. Check. Average income of chinese overall is 5 times higher than Indian. Even under such harsh climate and geography conditions average Tibetan is still 3 times richer than Indians. So average income of Han and Tibetan Chinese is closer. Check. Tell me, other than your ugly territory ambition toward Tibet, which parts are Indians closer to Tibet? BTW, Islam Kashmir are definitely closer to Pakistan both in culture ,geography, race. Why should Kashmir be part of India?

Tibetans belonged to a sub group of Sino-Tibetan tribal union 4800 years ago. This tribal union broke up when Tibetans moved to the plateau through Qinghai and Han moved to east China though Gansu. So Tibet is always closer to China, since there is at least some routes between the China proper and Tibet in Qinghai. While the border near India is a huge mountain of 8000 meters’ height and 2000 kilometers’ length. As for the cultural part, Tibet is closer to India in written language, but all the other stuff are all closer to Han China.
